Name: Headdress of statue of a queen (?)
Description: Headdress of an over life-size statue, consisting of uraeus diadem, Hathor horns with sun disc and a pair of falcon's feathers on the back pillar. The break occurs just below the diadem.This combination of elements is known for queens from the late 18th Dynasty onwards, and for God's Wives in the Late Period. The dating to the Ramesside Period (thereby opting for the head-dress of a queen) is mainly based on the size of the statue, which would be unusual for the Late Period.
